sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import '../App.css'; import Disclaimer from '../../components/Disclaimer'; const CairnCare = () => { return (
Hair cutting
I have gone to a professional groomer and had their haircut at home. I have found that a hair cutting technic referred to as hand stripping allows the cairn to retain their wire hair-like texture and in doing so gives them a waterproof type layer of fur.

Every cairn is a little different when it comes to getting a hair buzzed hair cut. I had my sire hair buzzer haircut when he was younger in age. His hair was very soft afterward, but it is not as good at keeping him warm or waterproof.

I never got my sire hair cut with hand strippers. His hair now, after well over a year has become more wire type hair in some spots, despite only cutting with hair buzzers. My dams are all hand stripped, but I had one hair buzz haircut when she was younger. It stunted her hair growth. Hand stripping is preferred for Carins but not necessary.
Nail Trimming
This is something I recommend for a groomer as well, but you will know you're getting closer to the time to get nails cut when it has been a while. You can also hear their nails tap on floors or any in excessive amounts. Cairns has black nails, you can't see the nail quick.

Letting your puppies' nails grow out too long can actually be more painful for them than cutting them too short as well. your groomer will have a good guideline for you to follow about how long and when to get their nails cut.
Shedding
I have found when the season changes from winter to summer that Cairns will shed quite a bit. Brushing their coat during the seasons changing can significantly reduce shedding, normally around once a week, hair brushing well can help a lot, if not twice a week can help completely reduce shedding.


); } export default CairnCare;
